weekly_instructions.breakfast: Blend your favorite fruits, a scoop of yogurt, a splash of milk, and a spoonful of honey until smooth. Add ice if desired.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Place eggs in a pot of cold water. Bring the water to a boil, then turn off the heat and let the eggs sit for 9-12 minutes. Rinse with cold water and peel.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees. Place the frozen burritos on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until heated through.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Toast your bread to desired crispness. Spread with butter, jam, or other toppings as desired.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Mix together flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then pour 1/4 cup of batter onto a hot griddle. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Mix together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then spoon into a greased muffin tin. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Blend together a ripe banana, a scoop of chocolate protein powder, a spoonful of honey, and a splash of milk until smooth.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Mix together flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Pour the batter onto a hot waffle iron and cook until golden and crisp.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Place eggs in a pot of cold water. Bring the water to a boil, then turn off the heat and let the eggs sit for 9-12 minutes. Rinse with cold water and peel.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Combine oats, milk, yogurt, and sweetener in a jar. Stir well, then cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, stir again and add any desired toppings.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees. Place the frozen burritos on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until heated through.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Mix together flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then pour 1/4 cup of batter onto a hot griddle. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Blend together a ripe peach, a scoop of vanilla protein powder, a spoonful of honey, and a splash of milk until smooth.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Mix together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then spoon into a greased muffin tin. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Mix together flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter. Pour the batter onto a hot waffle iron and cook until golden and crisp.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Blend together a variety of your favorite fruits, a scoop of yogurt, a splash of milk, and a spoonful of honey until smooth. Add ice if desired.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Mix together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, melted butter, and blueberries. Spoon into a greased muffin tin and bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Toast your bread to desired crispness. Spread with butter, jam, or other toppings as desired.

weekly_instructions.breakfast: Blend together a handful of spinach, a ripe banana, a scoop of protein powder, a spoonful of honey, and a splash of milk until smooth.
weekly_instructions.lunch: Combine oats, milk, yogurt, and peanut butter in a jar. Stir well, then cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, stir again and add any desired toppings.
weekly_instructions.dinner: Boil water or milk in a pot. Stir in the oatmeal packet, reduce heat to low, and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
